doc.after: Prospective service members are often recruited from high school or college, the target age ranges being 18â35 in the Army, 18â28 in the Marine Corps, 18â34 in the Navy, 18â39 in the Air Force, and 18â27 (up to age 32 if qualified for attending guaranteed "A" school) in the Coast Guard. With the permission of a parent or guardian, applicants can enlist at age 17 and participate in the Delayed Entry Program (DEP), in which the applicant is given the opportunity to participate in locally sponsored military activities, which can range from sports to competitions led by recruiters or other military liaisons (each recruiting station's DEP varies).
